required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Single-Center Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion of [14C]-AZD3293
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Single-Center Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion After Oral Administration of [14C]-AZD3293 to Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be an open-label, non-randomized, absorption, metabolism, and excretion study to evaluate the mass balance, metabolite profiles, and rates and routes of elimination of [14C]-AZD3293 and derived metabolites following administration as a single 100-mg (containing approximately 150 µCi) oral dose (as an oral solution)

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be an open-label, non-randomized,absorption, metabolism, and excretion study to evaluate the mass balance, metabolite profiles, and rates and routes of elimination of [14C]-AZD3293 and derived metabolites following administration as a single 100-mg (containing approximately 150 µCi) oral dose (as an oral solution) following at least an 8-hour fast from food (not including water). Seven healthy male subjects will be enrolled in the study at a single study site to complete a minimum of 6 subjects. The study will consist of 2 visits.

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters measured by assessment of AUC over time and Maximum observed concentration (Cmax)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed concentration (Cmax) parameters will be calculated, for AZD3293, its metabolite; and [14C]-AZD3293-derived total radioactivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessments including vital sign measurements, ECGs, physical examinations, clinical laboratory evaluations, and a record of adverse events (AEs).
secondary_outcome.description: Safety assessments including vital sign measurements, ECGs, physical examinations, clinical laboratory evaluations, and a record of adverse events (AEs), will be performed before and following investigational product administration.
The Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) will be used to assess the psychiatric health of subjects.
Time to maximum observed concentration (tmax) will be calculated for AZD3293 and its metabolite; and [14C]-AZD3293-derived total radioactivity.

Area under the concentration-time curve from Hour 0 to the last measurable concentration (AUC0-t), will be calculated for AZD3293 and its metabolite ; and [14C]-AZD3293-derived total radioactivity concentrations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-∞)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-∞), apparent terminal elimination rate constant (λZ), will be calculated for AZD3293 and its metabolite ; and [14C]-AZD3293-derived total radioactivity.
Apparent terminal elimination half-life (t1/2), will be calculated for AZD3293 and its metabolite; and [14C]-AZD3293-derived total radioactivity.
Apparent oral clearance (CL/F) (AZD3293 only), will be calculated for AZD3293 concentrations.
Apparent volume of distribution (Vz/F) (AZD3293 only) will be calculated for AZD3293 concentrations.
Ratios for AUC0- including the ratio of total radioactivity in whole blood/plasma; and the ratio of AZD3293 in plasma and total radioactivity in plasma, will be calculated.
